intro: Hieracium rhenifontis, commonly known as the Rhine fontana hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. It produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium rhenifontis is known for its ability to thrive in wet environments and is sometimes considered an indicator species for certain soil conditions.
